intro: Cyrilla cubensis subsp. nipensis, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lythraceae. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and wetlands. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptic to ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically pink or red, blooming in the spring. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds.
